page.title: 08Thoby Priory
page.content: Thoby Priory was founded in the middle of the 12th century (King Stephen's reign) by Michael de Capra and is named after its first Prior, Tobias. The property came into the possession of the Blencowe family about 1720. The Priory was demolished and rebuilt as a private house, using some of the original materials. After a serious fire in 1893, it was again rebuilt. It was bought by the Earl of Arran, a famous newspaper columnist, in 1920. The Priory was demolished thirty to forty years later and sadly, only two arches survive from the original building. The site of the Priory is now in the middle of a scrap-metal yard.
